body.p:
John Boyle 131
October 12th 3
M. Murphey
1st Lt & Q. M
50th Ky Inft
Sir,

Yours of the 7th instant having been refered to me by the Governor for a reply, I can only say that it has been customary, where two or more fractional regiments or consolidated each having a Quarter Master, for the Colonel commanding the consolidated regiment to elect which of the Quarter Masters he will retain

Respectfully Yours
John Boyle
Adjt Genl Ky.
